title: Interpret the Conditions
text: When Rick kayaked along the current, the current increases the speed and so the rate is $$5$$ + $$r$$.\nWhen Rick kayaked against the current, the current decreases the speed and so the rate is $$5$$ - $$r$$.
speech: When Rick kayaked along the current, the current increases the speed and so the rate is , 5  +  r .\nWhen Rick kayaked against the current, the current decreases the speed and so the rate is  5  -  r .

.When Rick kayaked against the current, the current decreases the speed and so the rate is   5

title: Set Up Equation For Problem
text: $$Distance=Rate Time$$. We can solve for Time and get $$Time=\frac{Distance}{Rate}$$. When Rick kayaked along the current, it takes $$\frac{24}{5+r}$$. When Roy kayaked against the current, it takes $$\frac{24}{5-r}$$. In total it takes $$10$$ hours. We can set up the equation as $$\frac{24}{5+r}+\frac{24}{5-r}=10$$.
speech: Distance is equal to, RateTime . We can solve for Time and get  Time, is equal to Distance over Rate . When Rick kayaked along the current, it takes , fraction, 24 over, 5 plus r,  . title: Solve For Unknown Using Quadratic Formula
text: $$\frac{24}{5+r}+\frac{24}{5-r}=10$$. Multiply both sides by the LCD which is $$\left(5+r\right) \left(5-r\right)$$. It turns the equation into $$24\left(5-r\right)+24\left(5+r\right)=10\left(25-r^2\right)$$. We can further simplify it into $$6r^2=110$$. Solve for $$r$$. If there is more than one answer, please enter it as (a,b) where $$a<b$$. Please round your answer to the nearest tenth, if applicable.

title: Final Answer
text: Since the current speed can not be negative, we omit the negative answer. So the speed of the current was $$1$$ mph.
